intro: Draba aizoides var. affinis, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–15 cm. This plant is characterized by its basal rosette of linear, glaucous leaves and produces small, white or pale purple flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, alpine environments and is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. Draba aizoides var. affinis is adapted to cold climates and is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
